p: The Kurdistan region of Iraq has a rich biodiversity and many medicinal herbs, including Eucalyptus species, are used by local people in traditional medicine since time immemorial [ 1]. A common antispasmodic and antipyretic remedy for treating respiratory tract diseases is prepared with the leaves of Eucalyptus camaldulensis Dehnh. (family Myrtaceae), also known as river red gum or Murrey red gum tree [ 2]. A hot tea is made and then the vapors from the aromatic infusion are inhaled by sick people. The empirical knowledge of this traditional medicine is passed on by oral tradition. No scientific rationale has been reported so far and the mechanism of action remains largely uninvestigated.
